info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 5 at 6:59AM EDT until April 5 at 11:30AM EDT by NWS Cleveland OH
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of northeast Ohio, including the following counties, Holmes, Stark and Wayne.
* WHEN...Until 1130 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 658 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.0 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. Portions of Stark County have been upgraded to a flood warning as flooding is expected to worsen as rivers and creeks respond to excessive rainfall. Please see that statement for details. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wooster, Millersburg, Alliance, Louisville, Orrville, Berlin, Rittman, Walnut Creek, Minerva, Doylestown, Hartville, Loudonville, Creston, Brewster, Navarre, Dalton, Shreve, West Salem, Waynesburg and East Sparta.
- Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 AM EDT THIS MORNING

area.areaDesc: Holmes, OH; Stark, OH; Wayne, OH
